document_data.name: I'tiraf
document_data.caption: A map of I'tiraf within the Cities of the Pantheon.
document_data.mainbody: '''I'tiraf''' was a large city that served as the capital of the federation of [[Cities of the Pantheon|Pantheist cities]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}} The governing body of the region, the [[League Conclave]], was located here.
document_data.Geography: It lay on the banks of [[Al-Hadi River]], directly across the [[Golden Gulf]] from the [[Cities of the Pearl|Pearl City]] of [[Jumlat]].<ref>
document_data.Society: Like all Cities of the Pantheon, I'tiraf held to strict moral standards and exclusive belief in the five [[Gods of the Pantheon]].<ref> Citizens strongly believed in the comparative barbarism of people from outside the Pantheist League, and the city had a reputation for finding out breakers of the law and punishing them swiftly, leading to its title "City of Confessions".
document_data.Trade: Apart from priests and [[sage]]s in religious lore, I'tiraf exported glassware and crystals.
document_data.Defenses: The [[Sword of the True Gods]] kept 8,000 soldiers and 3,000 cavalry stationed in I'tiraf. The city also maintained a watch of 2,000 guards and 300 clerical reserves. Six [[mamluk]] units of the [[Exalted Mamluk Society|Exalted]] and [[Devoted Mamluk Society]], numbering 1,800 men, also served here. I'tiraf's navy consisted of 16 ships.
